title: The City According To Caroline
name: The City According To Caroline
description:
A Map by Okaythatscool

Some fun things I've found in and around Manhattan since moving there in June 2006.

properties.name: Apple Restaurant & Bombar
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 17 Waverly Pl, New York, NYI really didn\'t expect something like this to be found in the NYU area. I was pleasantly surprised. Haven\'t tried the food, but the bar was a great atmosphere.

properties.name: B.E.D. Nightclub
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  530 W 27th St., New York, NYThis place, as well as the surrounding Outer Chelsea neighborhood, have gotten a lot of negative buzz for being a massive drunk tank of underage drinkers. The buzz is pretty much all true. But the only time I went here was for Michael Arrington\'s TechCrunch party in November \'06. Talk about out-of-place for this nabe.

properties.name: Bamn!
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  37 St. Mark\'s Place, New York, NYThis is the establishment that kick-started my love affair with mozzarella sticks. If I\'m out in the East Village, you can bet I stop here for a late-night snack.

properties.name: Black Bear Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool274 3rd Avenue, New York, NY

properties.name: Cipriani 42nd
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 110 E 42nd St., New York, NYDear Steve Ballmer, Thank you for the sea bass and bellinis and strawberries dipped in chocolate. You almost made me want to install Vista on my computer. Almost. Love, Caroline

properties.name: Death & Co.
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool433 E 6th St., New York, NYIf this "temporarily closed" place doesn\'t reopen soon, I will be rather upset. You see, it\'s quite a nice place to hang out. There\'s vintage jazz music playing, the chandeliers are a nice touch, the bartenders wear pinstripe vests, and the drinks are extremely well-mixed.

properties.name: Dos Caminos
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 373 Park Ave. S., New York, NY 10016 Its proximity to the ZD building makes this a common destination for high-energy media power lunches, and by high-energy media power lunches I mean telling fun stories and gorging on yummy guacamole. Ooh, and their pomegranate margaritas are great at happy hour, except for the fact that the bar area is pretty crowded.

properties.name: Duvet
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  45 W 21st St, New York, NYYou know, I have only been here once, but it was one of the funniest "oh, my God, only in New York" stories ever. It\'s not my kind of place by any means, but I was out in the Flatiron District with a friend and decided to check it out. This was in December, and it turns out we had walked right into a particular "urban" clothing label\'s holiday party complete with free food and open bar. Oops.

properties.name: Element
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 225 E Houston Street, New York, NY, United StatesIt\'s a really unique experience (I\'m not being sarcastic) being one of about a half-dozen females at Element\'s gay dance parties on Saturday nights. I had a blast.

properties.name: Eyebeam
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  540 W 21st St., New York, NYOne of my favorite "galleries" -- actually, it\'s more of an art/technology center. Their "Open City" exhibit in March-April \'07 was my fave.

properties.name: Fusia Asian Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 677C Lexington Ave, New York, NYI went here with some friends in the winter of \'07 prior to an evening ice-skating excursion in Central Park. The random assortment of Asian foods is great when you\'re in a big group and there\'s a variety of tastes represented at the table.

properties.name: Gin Lane
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 355 W 14th St., New York, NYOnce upon a time, I went to a Halloween party here where I didn\'t know anyone. But everyone lived happily ever after. The end.

properties.name: Hotel Gansevoort
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  18 9th Ave, New York, NYI filmed a video blog episode here in which I looked at the gadget-equipped penthouse suite (including a Wii).

properties.name: Kyotofu
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 705 Ninth Avenue, new york, nyI was a bit skeptical about tofu for dessert, but I went here with two friends after dinner at a Thai restaurant and I thought it was fantastic.

properties.name: Le Pain Quotidien
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  252 E 77th St, New York, NYThe communal table? The fireplace? The green tea? Sign me up, please...

properties.name: Lunasa
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool126 1st Avenue, New York, NYThe bartenders have Irish accents. Enough said. Actually, that\'s not enough said. There is a great wooden long table near the back where I chilled with about a half dozen friends once; it\'s a great spot to have a glass of wine or a pint of stout. Typically, it\'s not that crowded either, so it\'s a nice atmosphere.

properties.name: MUD
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  307 E 9th St., New York, NYI come from a small town in NJ where there\'s a coffee shop that all the legit "locals" go to -- I wrote many a term paper there in college. This is the closest thing I\'ve found to an equivalent in NYC.

properties.name: Mixx Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 84 7th Ave S, New York, NYThis place has a corny name and is kind of cramped, but I like their creatively-named drinks. Ooh, and the mozzarella sticks are great too. Did I tell you I\'m obsessed with mozzarella sticks?

properties.name: One
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 1 Little West 12th St, New York, NYYeah, yeah, it\'s the Meatpacking District. I really only went here because Microsoft was throwing a party here, but I actually thought it was a very decent place to hold an event (i.e. when people aren\'t coughing up 2 for a cocktail). So if you hold events...think about this one.

properties.name: Pershing Square
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  90 E 42nd St, New York, NYHome of Darren\'s power breakfasts. :-)

properties.name: Pinkberry
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool  170 8th Avenue, New York, NYThis is the Chelsea location of Pinkberry, an LA frozen yogurt sensation that just recently arrived in Manhattan. I went here in late February, and while it\'s arguably even more overpriced than Starbucks, I sure did like it. I ordered the green tea fro-yo (one of their two flavors) with kiwi. Yum!

properties.name: Prey
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 4 west 22nd st., new york, nyTo tell you the truth, I\'m not a massive fan of this place just because it\'s way too narrow for what it is (the bar-lounge hybrid genre, in my opinion, needs to be more spacious). Still, I\'ve been here a few times and never had a bad time.

properties.name: R Bar
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool218 Bowery, New York, NY

properties.name: SEA Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 75 2nd Avenue, New York, NYThis place is great, if you\'re willing to deal with the bizarre party-rap soundtrack. I was here once and I think they played "in Da Club" three times. But it\'s delicious cheap Thai, so I\'m not complaining.

properties.name: Soho House
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 29 9th Avenue, New York, NYYep, I\'ve been here. Only once, for dinner with some friends (one of whom happened to be a member). Felt like I was living a Hugh Grant movie.

properties.name: Solas
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool232 E 9th St., New York, NYI went here on a Saturday night and it was packed; I went again on a Monday evening and we were the only people there. Go figure. Cool bar-meets-lounge decor though, and the bar snacks are good. They have what appears to be a pretty amazing happy hour, with half-price sangria, mojitos, margaritas, etc., but I\'ve never tried it out.

properties.name: Stanton Social
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool99 Stanton St, New York, NY

properties.name: Sushi Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool St. Mark\'s Place & Avenue A, New York, NYThis isn\'t the best sushi I\'ve found in the city, but so far, it\'s the best low-priced sushi. If you order enough, they cut the price in half...and they have sake-tinis from 10 PM to midnight.

properties.name: The Little Owl
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 90 Bedford St., New York, NYThis place is notoriously hard to get tables for at dinner these days if you ask any food blogger, but I\'ve never tried it for that. I have, however, had great luck with brunch here. It\'s definitely my favorite brunch spot.

properties.name: The Plumm
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 246 W 14th St., New York, NYYes, I\'ve been here. I went to see a particular DJ spin, and it was nice. But overall, this place isn\'t that amazing. The decor is nice, and when I went, the crowd was a refreshing 30-something set, but I\'m sure all the Us Weekly mentions have filled it up with the West Chelsea crowd by now.

properties.name: Uncle Ming's
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool225 Avenue B, 2nd Floor, new York, NYI went here for a friend\'s birthday, and the most hilarious part was the hentai that they were showing on a big screen TV above the bar.

properties.name: White Rabbit
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 145 E Houston St., New York, NYTwo words: Raspberry Gimlet.

properties.name: Yuca Bar
properties.description: Posted by Okaythatscool 111 Avenue A, New York, NYNo, I haven\'t been here for the tapas or brunch. But the mojitos are incredible.
